fullProgramDescription: The Bioengineering program at UCLA is an interdisciplinary field that applies engineering principles to understand, modify, or control biological systems. The program is designed to provide a rigorous foundation in engineering, mathematics, and physical sciences, as well as a strong understanding of biological systems and processes.
shortProgramDescription: The Bioengineering B.S. program at UCLA provides students with a comprehensive education in the principles of engineering, biology, and medicine, preparing them for careers in biomedical industries, research, or graduate study.
classHighlights: The program begins with foundational courses in mathematics, physics, and chemistry, including Calculus (Math 31A-31B), Physics (Physics 1A-1B), and Chemistry (Chem 20A-20B).
Students take core bioengineering courses, including Introduction to Bioengineering (BioEng 10), Biomechanics (BioEng 102), and Bioengineering Laboratory (BioEng 103).
Upper-division courses cover topics such as Biotransport (BioEng 101), Bioengineering Thermodynamics (BioEng 110), and Systems Bioengineering (BioEng 174).
Students also complete coursework in biology, including Cell Biology (MCDB 165A) and Biochemistry (Chem 153A-153B).
Electives allow students to explore specialized areas, such as tissue engineering, biomaterials, and biomedical imaging.
The program emphasizes laboratory and design experiences, with courses like Bioengineering Laboratory (BioEng 103) and Senior Design (BioEng 195).
Students also complete a capstone design project, applying engineering principles to a real-world biomedical problem.
learningOutcomes: Apply engineering principles to biological systems and problems
Understand the fundamental biology and physiology of living systems
Design and conduct experiments to analyze and solve biomedical problems
Communicate complex ideas and results effectively in written and oral forms
Work collaboratively in teams to design and develop biomedical solutions
Analyze and interpret data from biomedical experiments and systems
Understand the ethical and societal implications of bioengineering research and applications
additionalInformation: The Bioengineering program is accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET. Students are encouraged to participate in research and internships to gain practical experience.
